para.text: The purpose of these regulations is to require a nonresident who temporarily occupies or maintains a dwelling in this State for a period in excess of 30 days to obtain, upon application, a nonresident permit instead of registration.
This chapter applies to the following:
An individual who is not a resident as defined in Transportation Article, §11-149, Annotated Code of Maryland, and COMAR 11.11.06.02;
An individual temporarily employed in Maryland for a period not to exceed 1 year;

A nonresident who is a student enrolled in an accredited school, college, or university in this State, a bordering state, or the District of Columbia, or who is serving a medical internship in this State for a period in excess of 30 days;
A member of the armed forces of the United States or of the United States Public Health Service serving on active duty in this State, an adjoining state, or the District of Columbia; or
A visitor or vacationer temporarily maintaining or occupying a dwelling in this State for a period not to exceed 1 year, and maintaining a permanent dwelling in another state.
An applicant applying for a nonresident permit under this chapter shall provide proof satisfactory to the Administration of the applicant's nonresident status.
Proof of Nonresidency.
An applicant temporarily employed in Maryland shall provide a letter on company letterhead from the applicant's employer indicating the length of the applicant's employment in Maryland.
An applicant who is a student shall provide:
Valid student identification; or
A college registration receipt indicating current enrollment.
An applicant who is a member of the armed forces of the United States shall provide:
A valid U.S. military identification card; or
Written verification from the applicant's commanding officer.
An applicant visiting or vacationing in Maryland shall provide a written statement setting forth the reason and length of stay in Maryland.

section.heading: Evidence of Required Security.
section.text: An applicant shall provide proof that the vehicle for which the permit is to be issued is covered by the minimum amount of vehicle liability insurance required by Transportation Article, §17-103, Annotated Code of Maryland.

section.heading: Fees.
section.text: A nonrefundable fee as set forth in COMAR 11.11.05 shall be assessed each time new or substitute nonresident permits are issued or renewed. This fee may not be prorated.

para.text: Upon receipt of the nonresident permit, the applicant shall affix the sticker to the inside of the front windshield in the lower right corner within a 7-inch square of the corner.
On trailers, motorcycles, and any vehicle without a windshield, the nonresident permit shall be affixed in a position on the vehicle that is readily visible.

section.heading: Nonresident Registration.
section.text: The registration issued with the permit shall be kept with the vehicle and exhibited upon demand to any law enforcement personnel.

section.heading: Expiration and Renewal of Nonresident Permit.

para.text: A nonresident permit issued under Regulation .02B(1) and (4) of this chapter expires within 1 year of the issuance of the original permit and may not be renewed or reissued.
A nonresident permit issued under Regulation .02B(2) of this chapter expires annually, but may be renewed if otherwise eligible under Transportation Article, §13-402.1(d), Annotated Code of Maryland.
A nonresident permit issued under Regulation .02B(3) of this chapter may be renewed if the registration plates of the vehicle to which it is issued are valid.
A nonresident permit issued under Regulation .02B(4) of this chapter is valid for a period not to exceed 6 months in any 1 calendar year.
Upon expiration of the permit, the applicant shall apply for:
Maryland registration; or
A second nonresident permit if the:
Vehicle for which it is issued displays current registration plates certified by the owner's state or country, and
Applicant is eligible for a renewal under this regulation and Transportation Article, §13-402.1, Annotated Code of Maryland.

section.heading: Issuance of a Nonresident Permit by an Agent.

para.text: The Administration may designate agents to issue nonresident permits.
An agent shall be a:
Maryland-accredited school, college, or university;
County government, as defined in COMAR 11.15.18.01; or
Municipality.
Agents issuing nonresident permits shall ensure that applicants comply with the provisions of Regulations .01—.07 of this chapter.
In addition to the fee set forth in Regulation .04 of this chapter, agents may collect and retain a fee not to exceed $4 to offset any expenses incurred in issuing nonresident permits.
